channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘Can AI be an artist?’ A Sotheby’s auction tests the answer, while human artists protest AI training
item.description: The auction house will sell a painting created by a humanoid robot.

item.title: Live Updates: U.S. and Qatar Say Gaza Cease-Fire Talks Will Resume, but Offer Few Details
item.description: Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken said U.S. and Qatari negotiators would soon restart long-stalled negotiations, but that it remained unclear if Ha...

item.title: Is Afghanistan’s Most-Wanted Militant Now Its Best Hope for Change?
item.description: Sirajuddin Haqqani has tried to remake himself from blood-soaked jihadist to pragmatic Taliban statesman. Western diplomats are shocked — and enticed.

item.title: Jump Trading is offering 4-day-a-week tech jobs with $175K salaries, but they come with a catch
item.description: The trading firm is hiring a “weekend warrior,” emphasis on the warrior.

item.title: At BRICS, Putin Appears to Say That North Korean Troops Are in Russia
item.description: ‘If there are images they are a reflection of something,’ he said in a tongue-in-cheek answer to whether Pyongyang had sent troops to help with Russia...

item.title: 23 Nobel prize winners push for Kamala Harris, calling her a ‘better steward of our economy’ than Trump
item.description: Economists say that tariffs and tax cuts make Trump’s plan weaker than Harris’

item.title: As Bird Flu Spreads, Additional Human Infection Is Reported in Missouri
item.description: Two people sharing a home caught the virus without known exposure to animals. More than 30 human cases have been reported in the United States.

item.title: Onions Recalled in Deadly E.Coli Outbreaks Linked to McDonald’s Quarter Pounders
item.description: The deadly outbreak spurred a recall of onions by a major food supplier in the Mountain West. Taco Bell, KFC and Pizza Hut have stopped serving onions...

item.title: Tesla now says cheaper cars are on the horizon—including possibly the rumored Model 2—after reportedly scrapping its plans for a $25,000 vehicle earlier this year
item.description: The company had long promised “an even more affordable car” after the Model S and Model 3.

item.title: Teens Think Movies and TV Shows Have Too Much Sex, Study Finds
item.description: At least that is what they told researchers at U.C.L.A. The high popularity of romance plots in movies and shows suggests otherwise.

item.title: Israeli Attack Killed 3 More of Its Soldiers in the South, Lebanon Says
item.description: Israel’s military said it was looking into whether its forces had “accidentally harmed” Lebanese soldiers while conducting raids in southern Lebanon a...

item.title: India Evacuates 1 Million as Tropical Cyclone Dana Nears
item.description: With the storm forecast to make landfall by early Friday, residents in parts of West Bengal and Odisha States took shelter in thousands of camps.

item.title: Prosecutor Expected to Seek Resentencing of Menendez Brothers
item.description: A request from George Gascón, the district attorney for Los Angeles County, could lead to the brothers being released from prison, decades after they ...

item.title: Prominent data scientist on latest election odds: Trump leads, but Harris is gaining
item.description: Thomas Miller, a data scientist and professor at Northwestern University, says the 2024 presidential race has whipsawed over the past several weeks.

item.title: Is Afghanistan’s Most-Wanted Militant Now Its Best Hope for Change?
item.description: Sirajuddin Haqqani has tried to remake himself from blood-soaked jihadist to pragmatic Taliban statesman. Western diplomats are shocked — and enticed.
